title: Emacs does not like typestate error messages

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

body:
An example:

```
../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:38:27: 38:51 error: Unsatisfied precondition constraint (for example, type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/tra\
ns_uniq.rs:82:6: 82:32]) for expression:
content_ty(bcx, uniq_ty)
Precondition:
type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:82:6: 82:32], init(bcx [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:35:8: 35:52]), init(uniq_ty [../src\
/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:33:8: 33:52])
Prestate:
init(cx [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:26:0: 41:1]), init(llptr [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:35:8: 35:52]), init(contents [../src/comp/middle/trans_un\
iq.rs:26:0: 41:1]), type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:34:10: 34:42], !type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/tran\
s_uniq.rs:44:6: 44:37], !type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:82:6: 82:32], init(lv [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:30:8: 30:38\
]), init(node_id [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:26:0: 41:1]), init(bcx [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:28:8: 28:16]), init(bcx [../src/comp/middle/trans_\
uniq.rs:35:8: 35:52]), !init(trans_uniq! [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:26:0: 41:1]), !init(trans_uniq [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:26:0: 41:1]), init\
(uniq_ty [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:33:8: 33:52])
../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:38                            content_ty(bcx, uniq_ty));

```

When this turns up in an emacs compilation buffer, emacs tries to interpret `type_is_unique_box(bcx, uniq_ty)[../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:82:6` and `init(cx [../src/comp/middle/trans_uniq.rs:26:0` as file names/line numbers
